SecurityPolicyViolationEvent.summary: The SecurityPolicyViolationEvent interface inherits from , and represents the event object of a securitypolicyviolation event sent on an , , or {{domxref("WorkerGlobalScope/securitypolicyviolation_event", "worker","","nocode")}} when its Content Security Policy (CSP) is violated.

remarks.para:
-HTTP Content Security Policy (CSP)
-
-The event of the interface
-The event of the interface
-The event of the interface

SecurityPolicyViolationEventBlockedURI.summary: The blockedURI read-only property of the interface is a string representing the URI of the resource that was blocked because it violates a Content Security Policy (CSP).
SecurityPolicyViolationEventBlockedURI.value: A string representing the URI of the blocked resource.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventColumnNumber.summary: The columnNumber read-only property of the interface is the column number in the document or worker script at which the Content Security Policy (CSP) violation occurred.
SecurityPolicyViolationEventColumnNumber.value: A number representing the column number where the violation occurred.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventDisposition.summary: The disposition read-only property of the interface indicates how the violated Content Security Policy (CSP) is configured to be treated by the user agent.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventDocumentURI.summary: The documentURI read-only property of the interface is a string representing the URI of the document or worker in which the Content Security Policy (CSP) violation occurred.
SecurityPolicyViolationEventDocumentURI.value: A string representing the URI of the document or worker in which the violation occurred.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventEffectiveDir.summary: The effectiveDirective read-only property of the interface is a string representing the Content Security Policy (CSP) directive that was violated.
SecurityPolicyViolationEventEffectiveDir.value: A string representing the particular Content-Security-Policy directive that was violated.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventLineNumber.summary: The lineNumber read-only property of the interface is the line number in the document or worker script at which the Content Security Policy (CSP) violation occurred.
SecurityPolicyViolationEventLineNumber.value: A number representing the line number at which the violation occurred.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventOriginalPoli.summary: The originalPolicy read-only property of the interface is a string containing the Content Security Policy (CSP) whose enforcement uncovered the violation.
SecurityPolicyViolationEventOriginalPoli.value: A string representing the policy whose enforcement uncovered the violation.This is the string in the Content-Security-Policy HTTP header that contains the list of directives and their values that make the CSP policy.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventReferrer.summary:
The referrer read-only property of the interface is a string representing the referrer for the resources whose Content Security Policy (CSP) was violated.
This will be a URL or null.
SecurityPolicyViolationEventReferrer.value: A string representing the URL for the referrer of the resources whose policy was violated, or null.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventSample.summary: The sample read-only property of the interface is a string representing a sample of the resource that caused the Content Security Policy (CSP) violation.

remarks.para:
This is only script-src* and style-src* violations, when the corresponding Content-Security-Policy directive contains the 'report-sample' keyword.
In addition, this will only be populated if the resource is an inline script, event handler, or style â€” external resources causing a violation will not generate a sample.

blockquote.para:
Violation reports should be considered attacker-controlled data.
The content of this field should be sanitized before storing or rendering.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventSample.value: A string containing a sample of the resource that caused the violation, usually the first 40 characters, or the empty string.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventSecurityPoli.summary: The SecurityPolicyViolationEvent() constructor creates a new object.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventSourceFile.summary: The sourceFile read-only property of the interface is a string representing the URL of the script in which the Content Security Policy (CSP) violation occurred.
SecurityPolicyViolationEventSourceFile.value: A string representing the URL of the script in which the violation occurred, or null if the violation is not in a script.Note that both columnNumber and lineNumber should have non-null values if this property is not null.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventStatusCode.summary: The statusCode read-only property of the interface is a number representing the HTTP status code of the window or worker in which the Content Security Policy (CSP) violation occurred.
SecurityPolicyViolationEventStatusCode.value: A number representing the status code of the window or worker in which the violation occurred.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventViolatedDire.summary: The violatedDirective read-only property of the interface is a string representing the Content Security Policy (CSP) directive that was violated.

remarks.para: This is a historical alias of , and has the same value.

SecurityPolicyViolationEventViolatedDire.value: A string representing the Content-Security-Policy directive that was violated.
